title: Woman pilgrim from Delhi held with loaded pistol at Vaishno Devi shrine
content: The licence for the gun found in the possession of Jyoti Gupta was found to have expired a couple of years ago, the officials said

title: INTACH to offer `Pada Seva’ to devotees trekking to Srisailam
content: The volunteers of Indian National Trust for Art and Cultural Heritage’s Nandyal unit  would be offering foot massage to thousands of devotees from Karnataka and Maharashtra who would be trekking long distances to reach the famous Shaivaite shrine of Srisailam for the Ugani celebrations.

title: Supreme Court to consider if Lokpal has jurisdiction over judges
content: Can someone go to a police station and file and FIR against a judge, senior advocate Kapil Sibal asks

title: Nagpur violence seems premeditated; mob targeted specific houses, says Maharashtra CM Fadnavis
content: Curfew has been imposed in several areas of Nagpur city after a protest against Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb

title: Can't avail separate UPSC exam attempts as 'able' and 'disabled' candidate: SC to Puja Khedkar
content: The top court also extended the protection from arrest granted to Ms. Khedkar on January 15 till April 15.

title: Devotee collapses while in queue at Rameswaram temple, dies
content: Earlier on March 16, a 50-year-old devotee from Karaikudi collapsed and died while standing in queue to obtain darshan ticket at Subramaniaswamy temple in Tiruchendur

title: Kerala Assembly: UDF stages walkout over Idukki encroachments
content: Opposition protests against Speaker’s decision to deny it permission for adjournment motion to debate recent revelations of large-scale encroachments in Chokramudi hills and other areas in Idukki

title: Sonia Gandhi demands ₹400 minimum wage, 150 workdays under MGNREGA
content: The budget allocation (for the scheme) remains stagnant at ₹86,000 crore, a 10-year low as a percentage of GDP, Sonia Gandhi alleged.

title: Delimitation issue: DMK walks out of Lok Sabha saying discussion denied
content: “The government has not responded to the concerns raised by Tamil Nadu. We are not being allowed to raise this issue. We want clarity from the government on this issue,” DMK leader Kanimozhi says

title: Bodies of Hmar, Zo tribes in Manipur decide to lift shutdown in violence-hit Churachandpur
content: Hmar and Zomi communities in Manipur’s Churachandpur district agree to lift shutdown after clashes, aiming to restore peace

title: Novel initiative in Telangana’s Karimnagar to take learning beyond classrooms
content: The students donned the role of vegetable vendors, promoting cultivation of organic vegetables and highlighting the nutritional benefit of organic produce

title: Centre with farmers without any discrimination: Agriculture Minister Chouhan
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra had sought an update on the implementation of the Vidarbha package, under which Kerala's Wayanad, Palakkad and Kasargod districts were also included, for farmers

title: 163 paneer samples tested by FSSAI in Karnataka
content: On March 3, following media reports and social media posts about adulteration, the Chief Minister’s office had asked the Commissioner of FSSAI to immediately examine the quality of paneer in Karnataka

title: Youths brawl over ‘camphor-laced’ MDMA in Kerala’s Malappuram
content: A group of youngsters engage in fisticuffs in front of local residents near Kottakkal claiming that they were ‘supplied poor-quality MDMA’

title: Tamil Nadu’s Government Railway Police strength remains unchanged since 1989
content: There is an urgent need to increase the manpower of GRP by 50% to give a sense of safety and security to railway passengers in Tamil Nadu

title: Attacker, victim put on par: Jaishankar on Kashmir
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar bats for a strong and fair United Nations at the Raisina Dialogue

title: BJP leaders Annamalai, Tamilisai booked for attempting to protest without permission
content: Police sources said Mr. Annamalai and 1,000 others were booked for unlawful assembly and staging protests without permission.

title: ED conducts searches against George Soros' OSF, linked entities
content: The case pertains to alleged foreign direct investment being sourced by OSF and the utilisation of these funds by certain beneficiaries in alleged contravention of FEMA guidelines

title: J&K’s governance dilemma amid political uncertainty and parallel power structures
content: Unlike any other State or administrative unit, J&K, with its history of turbulence, presents a complex challenge

title: Kannada Sahitya Parishat President Mahesh Joshi moves High Court of Karnataka seeking protection
content: The court asked the government advocate to get instructions from the authorities on the representation given by Mahesh Joshi in January seeking police protection

title: Om Birla calls for developing Delhi Vidhan Sabha as 'model' Assembly
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Birla said people have high expectations from the legislators and the new government in the capital

title: Trump's 'America First' policy is not America alone: Tulsi Gabbard
content: Ms. Gabbard said just like U.S. President Trump's 'America First' policy, PM Modi is committed to the 'India First' approach.

title: Rahul Gandhi meets visiting New Zealand PM Christopher Luxon
content: The meeting came a day after Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Mr. Luxon held talks and India and New Zealand inked an ambitious pact to institutionalise defence ties besides vowing to boost cooperation in the Indo-Pacific

title: Scholarship amounts under Social Justice Ministry not enough to meet costs: House panel
content: The panel also pointed out that several other flagship schemes of the Ministry – for livelihood assistance, skills-training, etc. - were fledgling, neither meeting their spending nor beneficiary targets

title: Curfew in parts of Nagpur after violence; Mayawati, Sena (UBT) hit out at Fadnavis govt
content: More than 50 persons have been taken into custody and five FIRs registered in connection with the violence in Maharashtra’s Nagpur city

title: Four cadres of banned outfits in Manipur held
content: Security forces recovered three arms, four hand grenades with detonators and other articles from Ngariyan Hill in Imphal East district

title: Those glorifying Aurangzeb are 'traitors': Eknath Shinde
content: Eknath Shinde’s remarks come amid demands from some right-wing outfits for the removal of Aurangzeb’s tomb located in the state’s Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar district

title: Madras High Court dismisses Seeman’s plea to club FIRs booked for speech against Periyar
content: Justice G.K. Ilanthiraiyan says, such an omnibus direction cannot be issued especially when the politician himself was unaware of the contents of all 50 FIRs

title: Land-for-jobs case: ED summons Lalu Prasad, kin for questioning
content: While Lalu Prasad has been asked to depose before Enforcement Directorate in Patna on March 19, his wife and former CM Rabri Devi, and elder son Tej Pratap Yadav have been asked to appear on Tuesday (March 18).

title: Nagpur violence: Locals recount attack on their houses and vehicles
content: Nagpur Guardian Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule will visit the violence-hit Mahal area later in the day

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 5 LIVE: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw replies to discussion in LS; Nirmala Sitharaman speaks on Manipur Budget in RS
content: Rajya Sabha saw a brief ruckus on Tuesday as AITC MP Saket Gokhale raised the duplicate voter ID issue.

title: ‘Muslim women’s liberation cannot be boxed into a single narrative’
content: Activists Najma Nazeer and Ishrath Nissar reiterated that Muslim women’s emancipation must be defined on their own terms, not by external frameworks that fail to understand the intersection of culture, religion and identity

title: Mamata visits Furfura Sharif for iftar, sparks political speculations
content: Mamata’s visit to Furfura Sharif comes days after she met with Indian Secular Front (ISF) chairperson and MLA Nawsad Siddique

title: Why are electoral reforms necessary? | Explained
content: Since when have votes been registered solely through Electronic Voting Machines? Why have certain Opposition parties accused the EC of electoral roll manipulation? Should criminal cases of politicians standing for elections be given wide publicity?

title: Man sentenced to 110 years in jail for abusing minor girl
content: The court also imposed a fine of ₹6 lakh on the convict, identifed as Remanan of Pollethai, near Mararikulam. According to the prosecution, the child was molested by Remanan for three years until 2021

title: VMRDA to spend ₹390 crore to improve connectivity to Bhogapuram airport from Visakhapatnam
content: Tenders likely to be called for in April, roads to be widened with scenic features, some of the roads to be greenfield roads, says VMRDA Commissioner

title: Ayodhya Ram temple will have no chief priest as of now, says Champat Rai
content: We had asked Acharya Satyendra Das 6 months ago; there is not be any chief priest now. There is no one of Satyendra Das’s age and respect, says Champat Rai

title: Pandemonium in Karnataka Assembly over Chief Minister’s remarks on RSS
content: Trouble began when the Chief Minister, while brushing aside the Opposition’s allegations that the law and order situation had collapsed, made certain remarks against the RSS and its role with respect to law and order

title: Railways out of financial stress of pandemic years: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Lok Sabha begins discussion on Railways’ demands for grants, Opposition questions delay in appointments

title: Nagpur violent clash LIVE updates: More than 50 persons taken into custody; five FIRs registered, says Police Commissioner
content: Tensions escalated as rumour spread that a holy book was burnt during protests demanding the removal of Aurangzeb’s tomb

title:
Every day, pedestrians dice with death
in city as open drains pose a safety threat
content: Parts of drains left open at Kottooli on Mavoor Road, near Kanakalaya Bank on Kannur Road, and near St. Joseph’s School on Silk Street giving nightmares to the public

title: Violence erupts in Nagpur as Bajrang Dal, VHP protest for removal of Aurangzeb’s tomb
content: Violent protests erupt in Nagpur over Aurangzeb’s tomb demolition demand, leading to tension and clashes between communities

title: CM pats student for innovative app that detects heart diseases in 7 seconds
content: Naidu encourages the Anantapur boy, now settled in U.S., to pursue further innovations in AI, and assures him of govt. support

title: No one feels safe in Bihar today, says Tejashwi Yadav
content: The Leader of Opposition said Chief Minister Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government has failed to contain law and order situation in the State. As many as 60,000 murders, 25,000 rapes and the highest number of killings of policemen and assaults have taken place in the State during the regime of Mr. Kumar, he said in the assembly.

title: SP MP demands PM Modi’s response on Trump’s ‘grant for voter turnout’ claim
content: The PM has not spoken a word despite the claims of interference of a foreign entity in our election process, Ramji Lal Suman said in the Rajya Sabha, adding that the government’s silence adds to the suspicion.

title: Survey works initiated for dyke wall, surveillance road along Eloor-Edayar stretch of Periyar
content: The survey is a preliminary step toward implementing the project, which is part of the long-term initiatives under the Periyar River Action Plan

title: Viral meningitis: Health department steps up surveillance in Ernakulam
content: The tests revealed the presence of enteroviruses in the samples, which are usually transmitted through contact with secretions from an infected person

title: Delhi HC asks Centre to consider as representation plea to rename India as Bharat
content: Justice Sachin Datta recorded that the petitioner seeks to withdraw the present petition to pursue the matter with the ministries concerned for disposal in terms of the June 3, 2020 order passed by the Supreme Court

title: Workers’ meet to discuss strike against Labour Codes
content: Central Trade Unions said the convention is being held in the background of the Centre’s “stubborn stand” to implement four Labour Codes

title: Double-engine govt has fallen flat in Manipur, says Opposition
content: Initiating the debate while discussing the Manipur Budget for 2025-26, senior Congress MP Shaktisinh Gohil asked the BJP to act beyond narrow political interests to serve the country; he criticised the PM for not visiting the State following violence

title: India, Australia agree to deepen interoperability across maritime, land and air domains
content: The two countries also decided to focus on cooperation in maritime domain awareness, reciprocal information sharing, industry and science and technology collaboration

title: PM Modi joins Trump’s Truth Social, thanks U.S. President for posting interview
content: In a personal outreach, Prime Minister Narendra Modi joined Truth Social, a social media platform whose parent company is majority-owned by U.S. President Donald Trump

title: Pelicans lose Murphy (shoulder) for rest of season
content: Pelicans forward Trey Murphy III will sit out the rest of the season after being diagnosed with a torn labrum and partial tear of the rotator cuff in his right shoulder.

title: Toppin hits wild 3 to lift depleted Pacers in OT
content: Obi Toppin hit seven 3s for the short-handed Pacers on Monday night, the last one an eventual game-winner with 3.5 seconds left to beat the Timberwolves in OT.

title: Rose win Unrivaled's first women's 3-on-3 title
content: Rose beat Vinyl in the Unrivaled championship game, capping the inaugural season of the women's 3-on-3 basketball league.

title: 76ers' George shut down for rest of season
content: Paul George has been ruled out for at least the rest of the regular season after receiving injections in his left adductor muscle and left knee Monday

title: WVU snub 'robbery' at highest level, gov. says
content: West Virginia Gov. Patrick Morrisey wants his attorney general to investigate and work closely with the NCAA to ensure the men's tournament selection process is transparent and fair.

title: Brink 'icked out' by replies to Sparks' male tryouts
content: Sparks forward Cameron Brink said she was unsettled by the response she saw online to a call by the team for men to try out for the practice squad.

title: Deion wants foe for CU spring game; Cuse willing
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders wants to save spring football games by having teams practice against another team for a week before playing them in a scrimmage.

title: Belichick flips 4-star Ruffin from A&M to UNC
content: Four-star defensive tackle Trashawn Ruffin, No. 238 in the ESPN Junior 300, flipped his commitment from Texas A&M to North Carolina on Monday, marking the Tar Heels' highest-rated new pledge since coach Bill Belichick took over the program.

title: It's bracket time: Make your picks for the men's tournament
content: The bracket is set. Here's everything you need to know about the competitors for this year's national title.

title: Your guide to all 68 teams in the men’s NCAA tournament
content: The bracket is set, here's everything you need to know about the competitors for this year's national title.

title: MLB's villains or its gold standard? How the Los Angeles Dodgers got here
content: Love them or loathe them, the defending champs built a new evil empire with a series of monumental moves.

title: 'I feel like I'm a more complete player': Players win a sign of what's to come for Rory in 2025?
content: After two early wins in signature events, McIlroy's game is in a great place with the Masters and the rest of the majors in the not-too-distant future.

title: You've signed a one-of-a-kind freshman in Cooper Flagg. Now what? Here's how Duke built a contender around its prized recruit
content: In an era when teams are incentivized to build around experience, the Blue Devils built a contender with youth.

title: NHL playoff watch: The Bruins' path to the postseason
content: It's a long shot, but the B's can still pull this off -- here's how. Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings, more.

title: How a 64-team college football tournament would play out
content: What if the CFP went as deep as March Madness? We picked our college football bracket and played out the first two rounds.

title: Newcastle's Carabao Cup glory, Barcelona's epic comeback, boring Arsenal-Chelsea, more
content: From Newcastle ending their nearly six-decade trophy drought to Barcelona's comeback for the ages at Atletico Madrid, it was another brilliant weekend across Europe. Gab Marcotti has what you need to know.

title: Sargent looks to carry 'flow state' over to USMNT
content: U.S. striker Josh Sargent described his current run of form with club side Norwich City as a "flow state where everything is just happening for you," but admitted his lack of production at international level is on his mind.

title: Messi out for Argentina after MRI reveals injury
content: Lionel Messi will not join Argentina for World Cup qualifiers against Brazil and Uruguay, failing to make the final roster after featuring in the pre-list.

title: Jamie Carragher's son receives Malta call-up
content: The son of former Liverpool and England defender Jamie Carragher has been called up for international duty by Malta.

title: Rabiot lashes out at PSG prez: 'Can't buy class'
content: Marseille midfielder Adrien Rabiot took aim at Paris Saint-Germain president Nasser Al-Khelaifi following his side's 3-1 loss to the Ligue 1 leaders on Sunday, writing on social media that "you can't buy class."

title: Man Utd season ticket prices to rise by around 5%
content: Manchester United have announced ticket price rises ahead of next season less than a week after unveiling plans to build a new £2 billion stadium.

title: Antonio vows to return to football after car crash
content: West Ham United forward Michail Antonio has insisted he will play professional football again after he recovers from being involved in a near-fatal road traffic collision in December.

title: Chelsea condemn racist abuse towards Fofana
content: Chelsea have strongly condemned the racist abuse faced by defender Wesley Fofana in the aftermath of their loss to Arsenal on Sunday.

title: Club mistakenly mourns player who isn't dead
content: The management of Bulgarian top-flight side Arda Kardzhali apologised after their former player Petko Ganchev, whose death they mourned in a minute's silence before Sunday's match with Levski Sofia, turned out to be alive.

title: What would it take for Wrexham to reach Premier League from League 1?
content: Wrexham's rise from nonleague has truly been the stuff of Hollywood legend -- no surprise given their owners. But can they now actually get to the Premier League from here?

title: WNBA trade grades: Did the defending champion Liberty get even better in trade for Cloud?
content: Natasha Cloud gives New York another skilled distributor and a stronger defense, while Connecticut gains two first-round picks to help its rebuild.

title: Men's first-round betting odds, lines, spread and BPI
content: Every set of betting lines, spreads, totals and more betting odds for the first round of the 2025 men's NCAA tournament.

title: Booed in Brussels, bound for WrestleMania: Highlights from John Cena's farewell tour
content: Here are the best moments from John Cena's "The Last Time is Now" farewell tour, which kicked off at Intuit Dome on Jan. 6.

title: Waiver wire pickups: Two Warriors to add now
content: The fantasy basketball waiver wire always has players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add this week.

title: Six March Madness stars to watch
content: Eric Moody breaks down which players fantasy managers should keep an eye on during the 2025 Women's NCAA tournament.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United scouting Sesko, Ekitike
content: Will Benjamin Sesko or Hugo Ekitike be able to solve Manchester United's goal-scoring issues? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Geovany Quenda can be Chelsea's answer to Saka
content: Chelsea look set to land the Sporting CP teen in 2026 and Quenda's style has been compared to an Arsenal star.

title: "Conspiracy...": D Fadnavis, Opposition Trade Jabs Amid Nagpur Violence
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and his deputy, Eknath Shinde, traded 'conspiracy' allegations with the opposition Tuesday, hours after nearly 40 were injured in violence in Nagpur over calls to move Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb.

title: "Misleading": Bangladesh On Tulsi Gabbard's Remarks In NDTV Interview
content: The Muhammad Yunus-led interim government in Bangladesh has expressed "deep concern" over the remarks of Tulsi Gabbard, Director of National Intelligence for the US, on the situation in Bangladesh.

title: Aurangzeb's Unremarkable Tomb Sparks A Massive Storm
content: Nagpur's Mahal area witnessed violence and arson last night. Cars were set on fire, stones were thrown and four civilians and over 10 cops were injured

title: Over 300 Killed In Israel's Biggest Strike On Gaza Since Ceasefire
content: At least 330 people were killed in Gaza on Tuesday as the Israeli military conducted "extensive strikes" on Hamas targetsamid stalled truce talks, the biggest attack in the war-torn territory since the ceasefirebegan on January 19.

title: Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore Head Back To Earth After 9 Months On ISS
content: Astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore are now closer home. They departed this morning from the International Space Station on the Dragon spacecraft after being "stranded" for nine months on the orbital hub.

title: Live Updates: Sunita Williams' Is Coming Home, Return Journey Begins
content: Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, the two astronauts stuck at the International Space Station for more than nine months, begin their return journey.

title: Curfew In Parts Of Nagpur After Violence Amid Aurangzeb Tomb Row
content: A curfew has been imposed in several areas of Nagpur after violence broke out over a call to move the tomb of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb out of Maharashtra. The 17th-century emperor's tomb is in Aurangabad, now known as Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar

title: Probe Agency Raids George Soros' Foundation, Amnesty, Linked NGOs
content: The Enforcement Directorate has searched offices of George Soros' foundation and non-governmental organisations linked to the OSF, including Amnesty, in what officials said was linked to an ongoing FEMA, or Foreign Exchange Management Act, case.

title: Missing Sudiksha Konanki's Parents Ask Cops To Declare Her Dead: Reports
content: Sudiksha Konanki, a citizen of India and a permanent resident of the United States, was last seen on March 6 at the Riu Republic Resort in Punta Cana town.

title: On Camera, Islamabad Residents Loot Laptops After Raid On Fake Call Centre
content: The call centre was allegedly involved in fraudulent activities and was operated by Chinese nationals in sector F-11.

title: Pakistan-Origin Cricketer, Collapses On Field While Playing, Dies
content: After fielding for 40 overs and batting for seven, Khan collapsed around 4pm Australian Central Daylight Time (ACDT).

title: Sunita Williams' Final Photo Op At Space Station Before Leaving For Earth
content: Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore will shortly depart for Earth after being stuck on the International Space Station for more than nine months.

title: Harbhajan Asked Dhoni About IPL Preparation At 43, Reply Left Him Stunned
content: Harbhajan Singh was stumped to hear what MS Dhoni had to say when asked about his preparations for the IPL 2025 season.

title: Opinion: PM Modi's Latest Podcast Is A Lesson In Tech Outreach
content: Modi's efforts to innovate and reinvent political engagement demonstrate his dynamic and ever-evolving approach to connecting with people.

title: England Duo Asked If They Would Play For Pakistan. Replies Can't Be Missed
content: England cricket stars Moeen Ali and Adil Rashid were asked if they would play for Pakistan, the country their roots lie in. They gave intriguing replies.

title: US Teacher Charged With Sex Abuse After Teen's Mother Finds Explicit Texts
content: Formella faces charges of two counts of aggravated criminal sexual abuse and one count of criminal sexual assault.

title: 'Democratic country must not function like police state', Supreme Court flags rising bail rejections
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: Watch: Capsule carrying stranded Nasa astronauts departs from ISS
content: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams are returning to Earth after an unexpected nine-month stay on the ISS. Their mission extended due to technical issues with Boeing's Starliner capsule, and they switched to SpaceX for their return. A relief crew's arrival enabled their departure.

title: Ban on mosque loudspeakers triggers return of an almost forgotten practice in Sambhal
content: In Sambhal, the removal of loudspeakers from mosques led to the revival of an old practice where men walk the streets, calling for sehri. Mohd Shoaib now takes on the role, ensuring no one misses the pre-dawn meal. Enforcing noise regulations, officials stress individual voices remain unrestricted, sparking discussions on religious expression and state intervention.

title: ‘Jinxed’ bungalow or political trap? Uttarakhand minister’s resignation fuels myth
content: Uttarakhand's R2 bungalow in Yamuna Colony is rumored to be 'unlucky'. Finance minister Premchand Aggarwal's recent resignation adds to this belief. Since the N D Tiwari-led Congress govt, several occupants, including Shoorveer Singh Sajwan and Harak Singh Rawat, faced abrupt political ends. The bungalow's reputation as politically jinxed continues with Aggarwal's departure.

title: “...so very very silly,” says engineer after Meta fired him for sharing Zuckerberg's post
content: Riley Berton, a former Meta engineer, claims he was fired for sharing already-public information with his wife, questioning the company's privacy policies. He alleges 'hundreds' of colleagues faced similar terminations amid Meta's crackdown on leaks, raising concerns about workplace privacy and personal communication boundaries.

title: 'Nectar of unity is key outcome of Maha Kumbh': Top quotes from PM Modi's LS address
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised Prayagraj's Maha Kumbh 2025 as a significant milestone for India during his address to the Lok Sabha. He credited the people of India, UP, and Prayagraj for their contributions and thanked them for the event's grand success, highlighting the global recognition it brought to India.

title: Melinda Gates responds to her ex-husband Bill Gates's comments on 'divorce mistake'
content: Melinda Gates responded to her ex-husband Bill Gates’s remark about their divorce being his biggest regret, noting the pain of the separation but recognising its necessity for her growth. She continues her work with Pivotal Ventures, focusing on women's rights. Melinda also shared career advice from Warren Buffett on prioritising impactful work for better outcomes.

title: Noel, Jejeebhoy sisters join board of Ratan Tata Endowment Trust
content: Noel Tata, alongside Shireen and Deanna Jejeebhoy, has joined the Ratan Tata Endowment Trust board. The Trust has also welcomed two Tata group executives, RR Shastri and Jamsheed Poncha, as new appointees.

title: 'Attacker, victim were put on par': Jaishankar takes a jibe at UN, cites Kashmir
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar questioned the consistency of global standards on sovereignty, political interference, and territorial integrity. At the Raisina Dialogue, he discussed historical injustices, particularly citing the Kashmir issue as an example, and called for a review of global governance frameworks to acknowledge evolving power dynamics.

title: Tomb talk: Why a UP outfit declared Rs 21 lakh cash prize for razing Aurangzeb's grave
content: A right-wing group in Uttar Pradesh has announced a Rs 21 lakh reward for demolishing Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's grave in Maharashtra. This follows statements by Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis supporting the tomb's removal, though emphasizing legal procedures are necessary. The group's leader, Dinesh Falhari, criticizes Aurangzeb for historical atrocities.

title: Bar Council bans lawyers from Bollywood, influencer ties, and social media ads
content: The Bar Council of India (BCI) has issued a stern warning against lawyers advertising their services on social media and through celebrities, calling it unethical and a breach of Rule 36. Violations will face severe penalties including suspension, revocation of enrollment, and contempt proceedings.

title: In India, Musk’s Starlink may offer 80-90 times more than…
content: Starlink, led by Elon Musk, is poised to offer significantly higher data throughput in India compared to its competitors. With infrastructure already in place, the service awaits regulatory approvals to commence. Starlink plans to establish three gateways and a point of presence to serve the Indian market.

title: Ford may export engines out of Chennai plant
content: Ford has finalised plans to repurpose its Chennai facility to manufacture and export engines, excluding vehicle production in India. The initiative aligns with Ford's global strategy and follows the company's exit from vehicle manufacturing in India in 2021.

title: Candidates call NEET PG 2025 in two shifts a 'flawed decision,' demand a single-shift exam
content: The National Board of Examination in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) has announced that NEET PG 2025 will be conducted in two shifts on June 15, sparking concerns among aspirants. Candidates have taken to X (formerly Twitter) to criticize the move, recalling issues with last year’s normalization process and expressing worries about the potential challenges of holding the exam in multiple shifts.

title: Vadodara car crash: 'Rakshit Chaurasiya may have insisted on driving'
content: CCTV footage from the investigation into a fatal accident revealed that Pranshu Chauhan initially took the driver's seat but then moved to the front passenger seat at the insistence of Rakshit Chaurasiya. Chaurasiya then drove the car and later crashed into three two-wheelers, killing one woman and injuring seven others.

title: Did Israel consult US before Gaza airstrikes? White House responds
content: The Israeli government, in coordination with the US administration, launched a significant airstrike on Hamas positions in Gaza, resulting in at least 69 Palestinian casualties. The operation is in response to stalled ceasefire negotiations, with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu authorizing the strikes.

title: Nagpur violence: Midnight silence follows hours of mayhem in Mahal’s historic quarters
content: Rioting erupted in the Mahal area of Nagpur following a protest by VHP and Bajrang Dal demanding the removal of Aurangzeb's tomb. The situation escalated by evening, leading to a heavy police presence and use of tear gas. By midnight, the area remained tense and filled with fear, with signs of violence and several detentions.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex rallies over 800 points; Nifty50 above 22,700
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Tuesday. While BSE Sensex rose over 800 points, Nifty50 was above 22,700.

title: Food poisoning probe reveals Ghaziabad girl, 7, was raped and killed by dad on Holi
content: A seven-year-old girl from Ghaziabad was reported dead after allegedly eating food from a neighbor, Shanti Devi. However, an autopsy revealed she was raped and murdered, leading to her father's arrest. The father had tried to frame Shanti by claiming food poisoning. Police found his claims were false and arrested him for the heinous crime.

title: IPL 2025: MS Dhoni love story, to be continued at CSK
content: When it comes to MS Dhoni these days, the start of every IPL is speculation time. Will this finally be his last season? Is he still sharp as a keeper? Can his body take the wear & tear? Apart from the brand value, is he still relevant in CSK’s scheme of things? For his legions of fans, though, these things don’t matter. Their hero’s presence on the field is enough.

title: Sunita Williams heads to Earth: How and where she will land, when and where to watch
content: Nasa astronaut Sunita Williams and her crew will return to Earth aboard the SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule after spending nine months in space. Their return, initially planned for Wednesday, has been moved up to Tuesday due to weather concerns, with a planned splashdown off the coast of Florida.

title: EXCLUSIVE | Shreyas Iyer will be our 'lucky charm': Prabhsimran
content: Punjab Kings have revamped their team and appointed Shreyas Iyer as captain, aiming for their first-ever IPL title. One of their key retained players, Prabhsimran Singh, is hopeful that Iyer's leadership will bring luck and success to the team in the 2025 season.

title: 'Misleading': Bangladesh slams Tulsi Gabbard remark on minority persecution
content: Bangladesh's interim government has strongly protested against US intelligence chief Tulsi Gabbard's comments on minority persecution, calling them misleading and damaging. The government emphasized its fight against extremism and urged Gabbard to base her remarks on facts to avoid stoking sectarian tensions.

title: WATCH: Pant recreates Gavaskar's 'stupid, stupid, stupid' commentary
content: Rishabh Pant recreated the viral clip of Sunil Gavaskar shouting 'stupid, stupid, stupid' during commentary when the Indian wicketkeeper-batter threw away his wicket in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Pant shared the clip on Instagram, seemingly for a brand. Gavaskar had criticised Pant for his dismissal in the fourth Test of the series in December 2024, calling it a 'stupid shot.'

title: Elon Musk's Starlink likely to face spectrum tax
content: Starlink faces a potential 3% spectrum tax on its adjusted gross revenue in India. This tax, alongside an 8% license fee, could increase service costs for the company. Discussions by Trai on pricing and taxes for satellite spectrum allocation are ongoing, with final recommendations expected soon.

title: Elon Musk wants ISS gone, Sunita Williams pushes boundaries for it's retirement
content: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore are set to return from the ISS after a nine-month mission, extended due to technical challenges with the Starliner spacecraft. Williams advocated against SpaceX CEO Elon Musk’s call to decommission the ISS early, emphasizing its ongoing contribution to scientific research. Musk suggested deorbiting within two years to focus on deep-space exploration.

title: Talks with Putin today on ending conflict in Ukraine: Donald Trump
content: President Trump plans to discuss ending the Ukraine war with Russian President Putin, focusing on territorial concessions and control of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant. Trump aims to secure a 30-day ceasefire proposal accepted by Ukraine. Russia demands security guarantees excluding Kyiv from Nato membership. Britain's and France's peacekeeping force offer may aid truce enforcement.

title: Israel launches deadly airstrikes on Gaza after truce talks stall; at least 200 killed
content: Israeli airstrikes in Gaza targeted areas around Bureij, killing several Palestinians. Additional attacks in Lebanon and Syria resulted in more casualties, including children. The escalation endangers fragile ceasefires, with both sides accusing each other of violations. Mediators work towards a lasting truce amidst continued blockades and negotiations.

title: WWE RAW Results and Highlights (3/17/25): John Cena Returns to End Relationship with Fans
content: WWE RAW in Belgium featured the return of John Cena as a heel, explosive matches, and chaotic conclusions. Highlights included Cena's confrontation with Cody Rhodes, Penta defeating Ludwig Kaiser, and a dramatic Intercontinental Championship match where Bron Breakker retained his title amidst interference and assault.

title: China welcomes PM Modi's positive remarks on ties
content: India and China expressed mutual interest in fostering cooperation and strengthening relations following positive discussions between PM Modi and President Xi Jinping. Both countries aim to implement the understandings reached during their October meeting in Kazan, emphasizing development, revitalization, and the overall progress of their civilizations.

title: Iran-backed Houthis claim a third attack in 48 hours on US ships
content: Yemen's Houthi rebels, backed by Iran, have launched three attacks within 48 hours on the USS Harry S. Truman carrier group in retaliation to US strikes in Yemen. These escalations, involving missiles and drones, follow a deadly US operation targeting Houthi leaders, risking further regional instability.

title: Denying bail in less serious offences unfortunate: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court raised concerns about lower courts denying bail in minor offences, despite completed investigations. They highlighted an increasing trend of such cases reaching the apex court. SC emphasized a need for a new bail law to ensure timely decisions, criticizing mechanical arrests and advocating for liberal grant of bail to protect personal liberty.

title: US concerned about B'desh minorities, will defeat 'Islamist terror' globally: Tulsi
content: US intelligence chief Tulsi Gabbard expressed concerns about persecution of minorities in Bangladesh and the global threat of Islamist terrorism. In a meeting with India's Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, she discussed the strategic security partnership and Singh urged the US to designate Sikhs For Justice as a terrorist organization.

title: Donald Trump once urged Wayne Gretzky to run for the Prime Minister of Canada
content: During a 2024 visit, Donald Trump suggested Wayne Gretzky should run for Canadian prime minister, humorously proposing Canada could become a U.S. state. Gretzky declined, preferring to stay out of politics despite past endorsements of Conservative leaders. While the idea entertained many, it highlighted Trump's unconventional views on U.S.-Canada relations and elicited some concern among Canadian policymakers.

title: We stand ready to work with India, says China
content: China has expressed appreciation for PM Modi's positive statements and the successful meeting between President Xi and PM Modi in Kazan. Both nations are ready to work together to implement their leaders' understandings and promote stable development, benefiting over 2.8 billion people in both countries.

title: Violent clashes in Nagpur: Section 144 imposed, situation under control
content: Violent clashes erupted in Nagpur's Mahal area, with vandalism and arson reported Monday night. Vehicles were set ablaze and stone pelting caused panic among residents. Police intervened to control the situation, deploying additional personnel. Authorities are investigating the cause, urging locals to maintain peace and cooperate.

title: T'gana CM seeks PM Modi’s appointment over backward classes reservation bills
content: Telangana CM A. Revanth Reddy has requested an appointment with PM Narendra Modi to discuss two bills proposing 42% reservation for backward classes in education, employment, and local bodies. Reddy seeks support from leaders of various political parties, all of whom backed the proposal in the assembly debate.

title: How does Josh Allen getting paid affect the rest of the Bills?
content: the most significant move the Buffalo Bills will make this offseason was addressed last Sunday . the deal ended with a meeting between quarterback Josh Allen and general manager Brandon Beane . it ended with the Bills giving Allen a six-year extension, overriding the four years he had left on his contract .

title: How Bengals' deals for Ja'Marr Chase, Tee Higgins impact draft plans, Trey Hendrickson; plus league intel
content: wide receivers Ja'Marr Chase and Tee Higgins agree to terms on long-term extensions they have wanted for years . the annual average of $40.25 million sets an NFL record for the highest average annual salary for a non-quarterback .

title: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: will Hodo beat the Crimson Tide 6-2 in the ninth inning . the Volunteers have earned their first no. 1 ranking of the season . they have a great opportunity to reclaim that top spot if they can beat now top-10 ranked Texas this weekend .

title: Women's March Madness: First-round betting odds, lines, spread
content: the 2025 women's basketball tournament is set to tip off as 68 teams look to win it all and make their mark on history . reigning champion south Carolina is looking to repeat history and give head coach Dawn Staley her fourth ring . a slew of dangerous teams no one wants to play .

content: Royce Lewis enters the 2025 season with career totals of 33 home runs and 104 RBI over 152 games and 605 PA . the 25-year-old has had great trouble staying healthy . he will miss the start of the regular season .

title: Winners and losers: UCLA’s rise, Notre Dame’s fall and South Carolina’s motivation

title: Lunardi: The one big thing the selection committee got wrong
content: seth greenberg is adamant that the Tar Heels didn't do enough to make this year's NCAA men's basketball tournament (1:14) the annual hand-wringing over the work of the committee has begun despite genuinely consistent selections in the NET era . this year, though: I am stumped. what coaches, administrators and bracketologists look for most from the committee is consistency .

title: NFL experts debate free agency: Which team made the best signing or trade?
content: free agency has started to slow down since officially opening on monday . some teams have made splash signings, adding standouts like Sam Darnold , Davante Adams , Justin Fields , Josh Sweat and Carlton Davis III to their roster . the best overall signing, re-signing or trade of free agency?

title: The women’s March Madness bracket is here -- so is your guide to all 68 teams
content: the bracket is set, and 68 teams are going dancing in the women's NCAA tournament . defending champion south Carolina to first-timer George Mason are in the bracket . there's no clear-cut favorite -- a fitting end to this riveting season full of star power .

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Avoid travel outside US, immigration attorneys tell H-1B, F-1 visa holders
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities.
